evidence.excerpt: Convert to exclusive appointment... Supplier shall not directly or indirectly sell or supply Products to any third party for resale within the Territory
evidence.reasoning: Pathfinder correctly identifies non-exclusivity as undermining market investment and proposes comprehensive exclusivity with performance tie.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Convert to exclusive appointment... Supplier shall not directly or indirectly sell or supply Products to any third party for resale within the Territory
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Convert to exclusive appointment... Supplier shall not directly or indirectly sell or supply Products to any third party for resale within the Territory

gt_evaluations.issue: Non-exclusive appointment with Supplier competition rights

evidence.excerpt: any increase...shall not exceed the lesser of (i) three percent (3%) or (ii) the percentage increase in the U.S. Consumer Price Index... Distributor may terminate this Agreement without penalty if aggregate price increases exceed such threshold
evidence.reasoning: Excellent identification. Adds 120-day notice, CPI-linked cap, and exit right on material increase.
evidence.judge_reasoning: any increase...shall not exceed the lesser of (i) three percent (3%) or (ii) the percentage increase in the U.S. Consumer Price Index... Distributor may terminate this Agreement without penalty if aggregate price increases exceed such threshold
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: any increase...shall not exceed the lesser of (i) three percent (3%) or (ii) the percentage increase in the U.S. Consumer Price Index... Distributor may terminate this Agreement without penalty if aggregate price increases exceed such threshold

gt_evaluations.issue: Unilateral price changes with no cap

evidence.excerpt: minimum of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000)... Parties shall meet in good faith to develop a corrective action plan; failure to satisfy the corrective action plan within the subsequent two (2) quarters shall constitute a material breach
evidence.reasoning: Reduces minimum by half and adds cure period with good faith negotiation before breach.
evidence.judge_reasoning: minimum of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000)... Parties shall meet in good faith to develop a corrective action plan; failure to satisfy the corrective action plan within the subsequent two (2) quarters shall constitute a material breach
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: minimum of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000)... Parties shall meet in good faith to develop a corrective action plan; failure to satisfy the corrective action plan within the subsequent two (2) quarters shall constitute a material breach

gt_evaluations.issue: Mandatory minimum purchase with automatic breach trigger

evidence.excerpt: consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld... Distributor may assign this Agreement without consent to (i) any affiliate... or (ii) any successor in interest by way of merger, consolidation, or sale
evidence.reasoning: Adds affiliate/M&A exception and consent not unreasonably withheld standard.
evidence.judge_reasoning: consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld... Distributor may assign this Agreement without consent to (i) any affiliate... or (ii) any successor in interest by way of merger, consolidation, or sale
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld... Distributor may assign this Agreement without consent to (i) any affiliate... or (ii) any successor in interest by way of merger, consolidation, or sale

evidence.excerpt: THREE (3) TIMES THE AMOUNT PAID... cap shall not apply to (A) INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, (B) LIABILITY FOR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT
evidence.reasoning: Increases cap to 3x and adds appropriate carve-outs.
evidence.judge_reasoning: THREE (3) TIMES THE AMOUNT PAID... cap shall not apply to (A) INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, (B) LIABILITY FOR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: THREE (3) TIMES THE AMOUNT PAID... cap shall not apply to (A) INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS, (B) LIABILITY FOR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT

gt_evaluations.issue: Low liability cap for both parties

evidence.excerpt: Supplier shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Distributor... from and against any and all losses... arising out of or relating to (a) any actual or alleged defect in the Products... (b) any claim that the manufacture, sale, distribution, or use of the Products infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property right
evidence.reasoning: Comprehensive indemnification clause addressing product defects and IP infringement.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Supplier shall defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Distributor... from and against any and all losses... arising out of or relating to (a) any actual or alleged defect in the Products... (b) any claim that the manufacture, sale, distribution, or use of the Products infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property right

(b) any claim that the manufacture, sale, distribution, or use of the Products infringes or misappropriates any intellectual property right

gt_evaluations.issue: No indemnification clause - Distributor exposed to product claims

evidence.excerpt: all Products shall be delivered DDP (Incoterms 2020) Distributor's designated facility. Title and risk of loss shall pass to Distributor upon receipt
evidence.reasoning: Shifts to DDP terms, transferring transit risk to Supplier.
evidence.judge_reasoning: all Products shall be delivered DDP (Incoterms 2020) Distributor's designated facility. Title and risk of loss shall pass to Distributor upon receipt
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: all Products shall be delivered DDP (Incoterms 2020) Distributor's designated facility. Title and risk of loss shall pass to Distributor upon receipt

gt_evaluations.issue: FOB shipping terms shift all transit risk to Distributor

evidence.excerpt: one percent (1.0%) per month (12% per annum)... Amounts the Distributor disputes in good faith shall not accrue interest during the pendency of such dispute
evidence.reasoning: Reduces interest rate and excludes disputed amounts.
evidence.judge_reasoning: one percent (1.0%) per month (12% per annum)... Amounts the Distributor disputes in good faith shall not accrue interest during the pendency of such dispute
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: one percent (1.0%) per month (12% per annum)... Amounts the Distributor disputes in good faith shall not accrue interest during the pendency of such dispute

evidence.excerpt: Supplier shall provide its approval or reasonable comments within five (5) business days of receipt; failure to respond within such period shall be deemed approval
evidence.reasoning: Adds deemed approval mechanism addressing GT concern about delays.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Supplier shall provide its approval or reasonable comments within five (5) business days of receipt; failure to respond within such period shall be deemed approval
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Supplier shall provide its approval or reasonable comments within five (5) business days of receipt; failure to respond within such period shall be deemed approval

gt_evaluations.issue: Marketing approval required for all materials

evidence.excerpt: Supplier shall repurchase any unsold, unopened, and marketable inventory remaining after such ninety (90)-day period at Distributor's landed cost plus freight and reasonable handling charges
evidence.reasoning: Adds inventory buyback addressing dead stock risk.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Supplier shall repurchase any unsold, unopened, and marketable inventory remaining after such ninety (90)-day period at Distributor's landed cost plus freight and reasonable handling charges
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Supplier shall repurchase any unsold, unopened, and marketable inventory remaining after such ninety (90)-day period at Distributor's landed cost plus freight and reasonable handling charges

gt_evaluations.issue: Termination effects lack buyback and transition

evidence.excerpt: Supplier shall accept or reject each purchase order within five (5) business days of receipt and shall not unreasonably reject any conforming purchase order. Failure to respond within such five-day period shall be deemed an acceptance
evidence.reasoning: Adds non-unreasonable rejection standard and deemed acceptance, addressing supply uncertainty.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Supplier shall accept or reject each purchase order within five (5) business days of receipt and shall not unreasonably reject any conforming purchase order. Failure to respond within such five-day period shall be deemed an acceptance
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Supplier shall accept or reject each purchase order within five (5) business days of receipt and shall not unreasonably reject any conforming purchase order. Failure to respond within such five-day period shall be deemed an acceptance

gt_evaluations.issue: Supplier can reject purchase orders - no supply obligation

evidence.excerpt: Distributor may accept and fulfil unsolicited orders originating outside the Territory through passive means, including e-commerce platforms
evidence.reasoning: Clarifies passive sales permitted, addressing growth limitation.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Distributor may accept and fulfil unsolicited orders originating outside the Territory through passive means, including e-commerce platforms
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Distributor may accept and fulfil unsolicited orders originating outside the Territory through passive means, including e-commerce platforms

evidence.excerpt: EXCEPT (i) DAMAGES PAYABLE TO THIRD PARTIES ARISING FROM PRODUCT LIABILITY, INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY INFRINGEMENT, OR RECALLS; (ii) DAMAGES RESULTING FROM A PARTY'S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT; OR (iii) DAMAGES ARISING FROM BREACH OF THE CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS
evidence.reasoning: Adds comprehensive carve-outs for product liability, IP, gross negligence, and confidentiality.
evidence.judge_reasoning: EXCEPT (i) DAMAGES PAYABLE TO THIRD PARTIES ARISING FROM PRODUCT LIABILITY, INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY INFRINGEMENT, OR RECALLS; (ii) DAMAGES RESULTING FROM A PARTY'S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT; OR (iii) DAMAGES ARISING FROM BREACH OF THE CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: EXCEPT (i) DAMAGES PAYABLE TO THIRD PARTIES ARISING FROM PRODUCT LIABILITY, INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY INFRINGEMENT, OR RECALLS; (ii) DAMAGES RESULTING FROM A PARTY'S GROSS NEGLIGENCE, FRAUD, OR WILFUL MISCONDUCT; OR (iii) DAMAGES ARISING FROM BREACH OF THE CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS

gt_evaluations.issue: Consequential Damages Exclusion Missing Critical Carve-Outs

additional_issues.notes: Approval process and revocation criteria are undefined, allowing Supplier unilateral control that can disrupt Distributor’s sales channels.
Blanket prohibition on “active” sales abroad is standard, but lacks clear definition of passive sales (e-commerce, unsolicited orders).
Distributor bears all shipping and insurance; no cap or optimisation obligations.
High effective 18% APR; silence on disputed amounts.
Supplier pre-approval with no response timeframe can stall campaigns.
No Supplier buy-back of inventory; only 90-day sell-off; risks dead stock.
If Distributor located elsewhere, Illinois law may be inconvenient.

Establishes exclusivity to protect Distributor’s market investments and eliminates channel conflict within Territory while still tying exclusivity to performance, aligning incentives for both parties.
Narrows Supplier’s reserved rights to prevent channel conflict and protects Distributor’s exclusivity, while still allowing Supplier to backstop supply failures.
Clarifies permissible passive sales, safeguarding Distributor’s online channels and minimising inadvertent breaches of territorial restrictions.
Provides certainty of supply and prevents arbitrary order rejections, enabling reliable fulfilment for Distributor’s customers.
Shifts risk of loss and import responsibilities to Supplier, reflecting Supplier’s greater control over manufacturing and logistics and ensuring Distributor receives goods in saleable condition.
Ensures transparency and cost control, while allocating transit insurance to Supplier, who is best positioned to procure favourable rates.
Caps pricing volatility, aligns with inflationary pressures, and grants Distributor an exit right if costs become unsustainable.
Lowers punitive interest, conforms to usury limits, and protects Distributor during genuine billing disputes.
Reduces financial exposure and adds remedial dialogue before breach, balancing performance expectations with market realities.
Prevents marketing delays and ensures a predictable approval workflow.
Retains critical implied warranties needed for downstream customer assurances and to mitigate Distributor’s risk of claims.
Restores critical remedies to cover Distributor’s principal exposure areas while still excluding remote damages for routine breaches.
Raises cap to commercially reasonable level and removes cap for high-risk scenarios where damages could far exceed annual spend.
Protects Distributor from dead stock and cash-flow impact following termination.
Extends confidentiality for sensitive information and secures injunctive relief to quickly stop misuse.
Aligns governing law with Distributor’s principal place of business, reducing litigation costs and uncertainty.
Introduces escalation ladder, relocates venue to Distributor-friendly forum, and preserves equitable relief.
Provides corporate flexibility for reorganisations and financing transactions.
Provides critical protection against third-party claims and product defects. To be inserted as new Article 14 prior to General Provisions section.
Ensures Supplier maintains adequate financial resources to cover potential claims, reducing Distributor’s residual risk. Position immediately after new Section 14.1.
Establishes a clear, cost-allocated recall process and enforces compliance with quality standards. Insert after new Section 14.2.
Addresses increasing regulatory requirements and allocates responsibilities for safeguarding personal data. Insert after new Section 14.3.
Enables Distributor to verify ongoing compliance and mitigate latent risks without imposing excessive burden on Supplier. Insert after new Section 14.4.
